intro: Harveya stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-sheath Harveya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from greenish-white to reddish. Harveya stenosiphon typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
